data.title: Einstürzende Neubauten
data.text:
HALBER MENSCH (DVD/CD)

(a film by Sogo Ishii)

Tracklist: DVD:1.Armenia(*)/ 2.Sehnsucht/ 3.Letztes Biest(am Himmel)/ 4.Abfackeln!/ 5.Zerstörte Zelle/ 6.Halber Mensch/ 7.Z.N.S./ 8.Yü-Gung(Fütter mein Ego)/ 9.Zeichnungen des Patienten O.T./ 10.Der Tod ist ein Dandy/ 11.Das Schaben.

CD: 1.Armenia(*)/ 2.Sehnsucht/ 3.Abfackeln!/ 4.Zerstörte Zelle/ 5.Zeichnungen des Patienten O.T./ 6.Der Tod ist ein Dandy.

Recording info: DVD Tracks 1-2,4-5&10 recorded/filmed live (without audience) @ the Nakamatsu Ironworks ruins,Tokyo on 28-May-85; tracks 8-9 recorded/filmed live @ Kohrahuen Hall,Tokyo on 21/22-May-85; tracks 3,6,7&11 filmed live @ the Nakamatsu Ironworks ruins,Tokyo between 27/31-May-85 (sound from studio albums).

CD contains the live tracks remastered by Boris Wilsdorf in 2005.

Notes: Line-up: Blixa Bargeld, N.U.Unruh, FM Einheit, Marc Chung & Alex Hacke. The film premiered in Tokyo on 25-Nov-85. (*)Also available on the "Strategies Against Architecture II" compilation album.

Includes extra CD containing the live tracks of the film.

Best and most complete version of this film, but still a copy from a much inferior master. In 2024, while in Berlin, director Ishii mentioned to the band that he has recovered a 16mm film negative copy, and would like to restore it and make a new theater-ready copy version, plus a version suitable for 4K blu ray release.. DVD: 58mins/CD:29mins.

Neubauten.org -YA1085-2 (DE,18-Jul-05) DVD-PAL/CD

(Silver angel cover. Authorized release)

2 disc special edition. Digipack.

LIEBESLIEDER (VHS/DVD)

(edited by Klaus Maeck & Johanna Schenkel)

Tracklist: 1.Prolog/ 2.Die Interimsliebenden/ 3.Stimme frisst Feuer/ 4.Wir können nicht spielen/ 5.Sehnsucht/ 6.Einsame Wölfin/ 7.News item/ 8.Krieg in den Städten (a.k.a. Steh auf Berlin)/ 9.Armenia/ 10.Hör mit Schmerzen/ 11.Der Tod ist ein Dandy/ 12.Neubauten exhibition/ 13.Ich bin's/ 14.Durstiges Tier/ 15.Hiroshima (Alexander von Borsig)/ 16.Tapes (Alexander von Borsig)/ 17.Decoder (FM, Andrew & Blixa)/ 18.Wolken Heim (FM Einheit)/ 19.Der Tod ist ein Dandy/ 20.Headcleaner/ 21.Harmagedon/ 22.Backstage/ 23.Ein Stuhl in der Hölle/ 24.Sand (Blixa Bargeld)/ 25.Sehnsucht/ 26.Hospitalistiche Kinder-Engel der Vernichtung/ 27.Vanadium-I-Ching/ 28.Letztes Biest (am Himmel)/ 29.Reading (Blixa Bargeld)/ 30.DNS-Wasserturm/ 31.Halber Mensch/ 32.New Music Seminar/ 33.Wüste/ 34.Interview Alex,Blixa & Andrew/ 35.Sand/ 36.Seele brennt/ 37.Salamandrina/ 38.Ubique Media Daemon/ 39.Blume

Recording info: 1. promo 1990 & recorded @ the New Jazz festival, Schlosspark, Moers on 02-Jun-90; 2&39. complete promo clip directed by John Hillcoat early 1993; 3&16. recorded @ Atonal festival in the SO36,Berlin 27-Nov-82; 4. recorded in Berlin in May-80; 5&8. recorded during the 'Berliner Krankheit' tour of Germany in Oct-81; 6. recorded @ S.O.36, Berlin on 14-Nov-81; 7. recorded for ZDF TV Aspekte Oct/Nov-81; 9. recorded @ the New Jazz festival,Schlosspark,Moers on 02-Jun-90 and @ the Noise Now! festival-WDR Rocknacht in the Phillipshalle,Düsseldorf 11-Apr-93; 10. recorded inside a pillar of the Stadtautobahn bridge,south-western part of Berlin in April 1981; 11. recorded for Designer TV,Berlin 1985; 12. recorded @ the 10 years EN exhibition in the Art Space Gallery,San Francisco 1?-Nov-90; 13. promo trailer from the Goethe Institut for EN's appearance @ the World Expo,Vancouver on 24-May-86; 14. recorded @ the Meervaart,Amsterdam on 06-Jun-82; 15. recorded during the 'Berliner Krankheit' tour of Germany in Oct-81 and @ the Tempodrom,Grosse Untergangsshow-Festival der Genialer Dilletanten,Berlin on 04-Sep-81; 17. excerpt from the film "Decoder" filmed by Muscha & Klaus Maeck in Hamburg in Dec-82; 18.recorded @ Steinschlagmauern, Bayern 1990/91; 19. recorded @ the New Jazz festival, Schlosspark, Moers on 02-Jun-90 & for Designer TV,Berlin 1985 & @ the Nakamatsu Ironworks ruins,Tokyo on 28-May-85; 20,23,30,33&37. recorded @ the Noise Now! festival-WDR Rocknacht in the Phillipshalle, Düsseldorf 11-Apr-93; 21. recorded @ the Storan Teater,Göteborg in 1987; 22. recorded @ the VEB Elektro-Kohle, Wilhelm Piek Saal,East Berlin on 21-Dec-89; 24. recorded in a London cab in 1985; 25. recorded @ the New Jazz festival,Schlosspark,Moers on 02-Jun-90 & the Atonal festival in the SO36,Berlin 27-Nov-82; 26. recorded @ the Bavaria filmstudios for ARD TV, Formel Eins in May-84 and broadcast on 14-May-84; 27. recorded @ Tempelhof-Dreieck, an unused part of the Stadtautobahn, Berlin in Jan/Feb-83; 28. recorded @ the Goldener Saal,Zeppelintribüne, Nürnberg on 22/23-Feb-86; 29. recorded @ a reading in München in Oct-89; 31. recorded in Japan 2?-May-85; 32. recorded @ the New Music Seminar, Ritz, New York City on 17-Jul-91; 34. recorded @ the Mojave desert on 04-Mar-83; 35. recorded @ the Metropol,Berlin on 20-Jan-85; 36. recorded @ the New Jazz festival, Schlosspark, Moers on 02-Jun-90; 38. recorded during the "Malediction" album sessions in 1991-92.

Notes: 100 mins compilation 1980-1993 mainly consisting of live concert footage. Track 10 from the "Stahlmusik" video (1981); track 15 from the "Die Grosse Untergangsshow" video (1981) by Wieland Speck; tracks 5,7,8&15 from "Die Berliner Krankheit" video (1981) by Klaus Maeck & Norbert Meissner; tracks 3,16&25 from "Ein Abend im SO36" (1982) a TV documentary by Albrecht Metzger; track 27 from the (30min) SF film "Spider's Goodbye" by Albrecht Metzger; track 17 from the "Decoder" film (1983) by Muscha & Klaus Maeck; tracks 19&31 from the "Halber Mensch" videofilm (1985) by Sogho Ishii; track 18 from the "(FM Einheit:)Stein" video (1992) by Walter Lenertz. A 50 mins excerpt of this video was shown on WDR TV on 22-Apr-93, titled "Nur noch Liebeslieder".

Studio K7 -021 (DE,Sep-93) VHS-PAL

Alfa -ALVB-24 (JP,1993) VHS-NTSC

Alfa -ALLB-24 (JP,1993) LD-NTSC

Music Video Distributors -MVD2730.3 (US,26-Apr-95) VHS-NTSC

Studio K7 -K7021DVD/RTD 387.0021.8[43](DE,25-Oct-05) DVD-PAL(side A)/DVD-NTSC(side B)

Navarre Corporation (US,25-Oct-05) DVD-PAL(side A)/DVD-NTSC(side B)

GRUNDSTUECK (DVD)

Tracklist: Nagorny Karabach/ Ein leichtes leises Säuseln/ Was ist ist (with the supporters choir)/ Rampe (PdR construction used as percussion, with supporters choir)/ Hex - Grundstück/ Grundstück:Fiver(Wann/Blixa singing/Choir/ November)/ Rampe (with supporters drumming on 50 tables).

(Total time: 66mins).

Also including as extras (some hidden) the following titles: title 3: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session 26-Jul-04 (5:27); title 5: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session -playing with the marbles (4:31) ; title 7: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session (5:06); title 9: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session 27-Jul-04 (2:57); title 11: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session (1:13); title 13: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session -making vocal loops (3:31); title 17: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session 06-Mar-05 (2:29); title 19: Berlin Palast der Republik -Rudy in action 03-Nov-04 (0:15); title 21: Setting up the installation table with styrofoam peanuts (1:05); title 23: EN symbol formed with styrofoam peanuts (0:32); title 25: Berlin Bunker studio: transcribed conversation about "Wo sind meine Schuhe" 06-Mar-05 (4:06); title 27: Trailer for DVD (1:16); title 29: Berlin Bunker studio: webcast session (0:38); title 31: Berlin Palast der Republik 03-Nov-04, photos by Stefan Köhler and Ian Williamson.

Recording info: Recorded live @ the Palast der Republik,Berlin on 03-Nov-04. Video production by Danielle De Picciotto. Sound by Rocco Weise.

Notes: Performance of "Grundstück" only for supporters of neubauten.org. Not included are 2 tracks from the concert ("Venuskolonie" and "Rampe"). This is a part of the "Grundstück" CD+DVD package (see Discography), only available to paying members (a.k.a. supporters) of Phase II (period Sep-03/Sep-05) of Neubauten.org, who were able to follow the recording process live via regular (30+) webcasts. Presented in a digipak, with a booklet containing the lyrics (DE/UK).

Line-up: Blixa Bargeld, N.U.Unruh, Alex Hacke, Jochen Arbeit, Rudi Moser & Ash Wednesday.

Neubauten.org -Neubauten-2 (DE 2x-Sep-05) Ltd. edition of 2,400+

SEELE BRENNT/NIHIL (DVD)

(by Christian Beetz/ by Uli M. Schüppel)

Info: "Seele brennt": contains the "Listen with pain/Hör mit Schmerzen" 57mins documentary (1980-2000) by Christian Beetz, mainly consisting of live concert footage. Same footage, but shorter and fewer clips, as the "Liebeslieder" video plus footage from the 20th anniversary concert on 01-Apr-00 and new (much better) interviews with the bandmembers (past and present) and former tour managers Jessamy Calkin and Jäki Hildisch.

As bonus: a 37mins 'behind the scenes' documentary filmed in April 1998 at Köln-Wolperath,Conny's (Planck, ex -Can) Studio at the "Silence is Sexy" album/"Total Eclipse Of The Sun" EP recording sessions with tracks: "Redukt", "Sonnenbarke", "Helium" and "Total Eclipse Of The Sun".

"Nihil oder Alle Zeit der Welt": a 58mins b/w film (from 1987) by Uli M. Schüppel, in which Blixa Bargeld stars, and for which Alex Hacke wrote the music and performed it with Neubauten members F.M. Einheit and Marc Chung.

Note: "Seele brennt" is the same film as "Listen With Pain".

Neue Visionen (DE,04-Nov-2005) DVD-PAL

ELEKTROKHOLE (VON WEGEN) (DVD)

(by Uli M. Schüppel)

Tracklist: 1. "Von Wegen" (91 mins): a film about Neubauten's first concert in East Berlin back in 1989. The film follows some of the concertgoers who are trying to trace back (sometimes literally) the paths that led them to the concert hall of the VEB Elektrokohle. They reflect on the road, which on the one hand led them to this once-in-a-lifetime pop event, and on the other to the German reunification.

2. VEB Elektrokohle 21-Dec-89 (1st show) (31 mins excerpt): Prolog - Feurio!/ Yü-Gung (fütter mein Ego)/ Sehnsucht/ Ich bin's/ Zerstörte Zelle/ Abfackeln!/ Zeichnungen des Patienten O.T./ Ein Stuhl in der Hölle/ Der Tod ist ein Dandy/ Der Kuss/ Haus der Lüge - Epilog/ Letztes Biest (am Himmel).

3. VEB Elektrokohle 21-Dec-89 (2nd show) (45 mins excerpt): Intro by Heiner Müller/ Prolog - Feurio!/ Yü-Gung (fütter mein Ego)/ Negativ nein/ Armenia/ Zerstörte Zelle/ Ich bin's/ DNS (Wasserturm)/ Ein Stuhl in der Hölle/ Abfackeln!/ Der Tod ist ein Dandy/ Letztes Biest (am Himmel)/ Der Kuss/ Spaltung (a.k.a. Armenisch Bitter)/ Zeichnungen des Patienten O.T./ Sand.

4. Zugabe (74 mins): FM Einheit, Fritz Brinkmann, Alex Hacke, Jaecki Hildisch, Blixa Bargeld and Uli M. Schüppel (try to) recollect what happened on that legendary day 20 years ago.

5. Dekonstruktion (2mins): the demolition of the Palast der Republik.

Recording info: "Von Wegen" filmed in Berlin during the summer of 2009. Two concerts filmed on 21-Dec-89. Audio of the concerts remixed by Andrew Unruh @ andereBaustelle studio, Berlin during Dec-08/Jan-09.

Notes: Film about the band's first concert in East-Berlin, 1.5 months after the Wall came down. This DVD is released exactly 20 years later.

Line-up: Blixa Bargeld, N.U.Unruh, Alex Hacke, FM Einheit and Marc Chung.

Good!Movies /Indigo DV 933508 (DE,09-Nov-09) PAL

V/A: BERLIN SUPER 80 (DVD+CD+BOOK)

(Music & Film Underground Berlin (West) 1978 - 1984)

Tracklist: DVD (Super 8 movies)- 01. Brand & Maschmann: E Dopo? (1981)/ 02. Christoph Doering: 3302- Taxi Film (1979)/ 03. Markgraf & Wolkenstein: Hüpfen 82 (1982)/ 04. Yana Yo: Sax (1983)/ 05. Maye & Rendschmid: Ohne Liebe gibt es keinen Tod (1980)/ 06. Stiletto Studio's: Formel Super VIII (1983)/ 07. Walter Gramming: Hammer und Sichel (1978)/ 08. Georg Marioth: Morgengesänge (1984)/ 09. Hormel/Bühler: Geld (Malaria Clip) (1982)/ 10. Notorische Reflexe: Fragment Video (1983)/ 11. Jörg Buttgereit: Mein Papi (1981)/ 12. Die Tödliche Doris: Berliner Küchenmusik (1982)/ 13. Butzmann & Kiesel: Spanish Fly (1979)/ 14. Manfred Jelinski: So war das SO 36 (1984)/ 15. Klaus Beyer: Die Glatze (1983)/ 16. Markgraf & Wolkenstein: Craex Apart (1983)/ 17. Andrea Hillen: Gelbfieber 1982)/ 18. Special Bonus Clip: Ika Schier: Wedding Night (1982). + Photo Gallery (300 photos) containing Die Tödliche Doris, Einstürzende Neubauten, Flucht nach Vorn, Malaria, MDK, Mona Mur, Notorische Reflexe, Sprung aus den Wolken, various bands, Super 8 Photos, Poster, Flyer, People, Bars & Venues.Total running time 109mins.

CD- 01. Mona Mur - My Lie (1982)/ 02. Malaria - Thrash Me (1983)/ 03. Die Tödliche Doris - Tanz im Quadrat (1981)/ 04. Christiane F - Wunderbar (1982)/ 05. P1E - 49 sec. Romance (1980)/ 06. Mono45 UPM - Romantic Adieu (1979)/ 07. Sprung aus den Wolken - Akcam La (1982)/ 08. Kosmonautentraum - Stolze Menschen (1981)/ 09. Valie Export & I. Wiener - Bananen (1980)/ 10. Alexander von Borsig (Hacke) - Hiroshima (1980)/ 11. DIN A Testbild - No repeat (1980)/ 12. Flucht nach Vorn - Nahost (1982)/ 13. Frieder Butzmann - Schmusewolle (1979)/ 14. Sentimentale Jugend - Wollt ihr die totale Befriedigung (1980)/ 15. Einstürzende Neubauten - Tanz Debil (1980)/ 16. MDK - Berlin (1982). Total running time 53mins.

Book- 100 pages, essays by Dietrich Kuhlbrodt, Martin Schmitz, Rolf S. Wolkenstein, Interview with Die Tödliche Doris. Photos by Peter Gruchot, Ilse Ruppert, Petra Gall and Anno Dittmer. Infos & Photos about all the Bands & Super 8 Scene. Impressions from the early 80s Wallcity. Tape Gallery etc. Texts in English.(German Texts included on DVD) .

Recording info: DVD- So war das SO 36 : Einstürzende Neubauten recorded live @ the S.O.36, Berlin on 14-Nov-81 (the last date of the 'Berliner Krankheit' tour). CD- Einstürzende Neubauten from the "Kollaps" album; Mona Mur included Alex Hacke, FM Einheit & Mark Chung, Sprung a/d Wolken included Alex Hacke & Jochen Arbeit; Sentimentale Jugend was Alex Hacke & Christiane F.

Notes: A DVD-flashback of early 80s Berlin subculture featuring output by virtuosos of the citys underground movie scene who rediscovered Super 8 as an adequate outlet for their creative endeavours. Accompanied by a compilation of music, covering a huge range of styles and currents - from punk to ingenious dilettantes, this lavish package recalls the walled in citys unique feel and lifestyle. Special digipak in a slipcase.

Monitorpop -mpedvd18 (DE,14-Feb-05) DVD-PAL. Ltd. to 5,000 hand-numbered copies.

Monitorpop -mpedvd18 (DE,14-Feb-05) DVD-NTSC. Ltd. to 5,000 hand-numbered copies.

AUSLAENDER RAUS! (DVD)

(directed by Paul Poet)

Info: "Ausländer Raus!/Foreigners out!" is a thrilling and revealing, funny yet frightening chronicle and deliberation of one of the biggest public acts of tongue-in-cheek art terrorism in the age of multimedia. Austria 2000: at the general election, Jörg Haiders FPÖ had met with widespread approval  and for the first time since World War 2 a party of the extreme right joined the government. Never slow to react, infamous German director Christoph Schlingensief soon retaliated with an extraordinary form of protest. As a tangible satire on xenophobia, Big Brother madness and new nationalism Schlingensief decided to stage an interactive concentration camp  right at the heart of Viennas picturesque tourist centre. And Austria just freaked  soon there were thousands of screaming people on site and almost a million connected worldwide via the Internet. Knife attacks. Punch-ups. Political intrigues. An incredibly heated week that captured the European drift to the right in real time. A hardcore route to democracy.

Neubauten did a 20 minute performance of which about 30 secs are shown in this film, made in 2002.

Recording info: Einstürzende Neubauten recorded live near the cathedral of St. Stephan,Wien on 17-Jun-00.

Monitorpop -mpedvd19 (DE,01-Aug-05) DVD-PAL.
